intro: Macleania irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazú mallow, is a flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers and hairy, broad leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
